title: Roxy Music’s Debut Album Turns 50
sub_head: The British band repurposed disposable rock culture and wrapped it in American glamour.
body: Like rockers John Lennon, Keith Richards and Ray Davies before him, Roxy Music’s Bryan Ferry went to art school. At Newcastle University in England, starting in 1964, he majored in fine art, started a band, and studied painting with British Pop Art pioneer Richard Hamilton, who was his link to American mass culture.
